This song is apparently about gamblers who never understood the Three Fundamental Principles in the first place.  The Three Fundamental Principles of Gambling are: I. n! = n * (n-1) * (n-2)... * 1, which will only work if n is a positive integer. For a non-integer, the *gamma function* is required. II. nCr = n! / (n-r)!r!, n and r must be positive integers. III. nPr = n! / (n-r)!, n and r must be positive integers.

Meaning of "Sharks" by Imagine Dragons  **"Sharks"** by Imagine Dragons uses the metaphor of swimming with sharks to explore themes of trust, betrayal, and the dangers present in relationships and everyday life. Rather than referencing literal sharks, the song portrays "sharks" as people who are deceptive, selfish, or predatoryâ€”individuals who appear friendly but may turn on you when it suits their interests.  Main Themes  - Betrayal and Trust:   The lyrics highlight the fragility of relationships, conveying how people you consider friends can sometimes become adversaries. As the song points out, everyone is capable of selfish behavior, making it difficult to distinguish true friends from "sharks" lurking beneath the surface. - Self-Reflection:    The narrative isn't just accusatory; it also asks listeners to consider their own actions. The band suggests that everyone, at some point, can act like a sharkâ€”looking out for themselves, sometimes at the expense of others.  - Lifeâ€™s Harsh Realities:     The song underscores the unpredictable and sometimes ruthless nature of the world. It encourages acceptance and resilience, advising to not dwell excessively on negativity but instead to laugh at the inevitabilities of life and move on.   - Irony and Humor:    Despite its dark themes, the band weaves in irony and a touch of humor, particularly in the chorus. This approach helps convey the message that, although life has its dangers and people can be untrustworthy, it's important not to take everything too seriously and to keep going with a sense of perspective.  Notable Lyrics & Imagery  - Lines like:   â€œYou think theyâ€™re really your friends, but when it comes to the end, youâ€™re just the same as themâ€;  point to the idea that everyone is capable of acting selfishly when pushed.  - The metaphor of:       â€œswimming with sharksâ€ captures the tension and uncertainty of navigating relationships, where danger might not always be immediately visible.   - Choruses with:    â€œlet it goâ€”thatâ€™s the way that it goesâ€¦ youâ€™re swimming with sharksâ€ remind us that ups and downs are a natural part of life, and hardships are inevitable.  Artist Commentary  Dan Reynolds, the bandâ€™s lead singer, explained that â€œSharksâ€ reflects the realization that the world is full of "sharks," but also invites listeners to ask themselves if they too, at times, act like a shark. Rather than taking a purely cynical view, he describes the song as striking a balance between dark self-reflection and laughing at lifeâ€™s seriousness, suggesting that humor and self-awareness are ways to cope with these realities.  In summary, *Sharks* is a self-aware anthem about recognizing and dealing with toxic situations and people, understanding our own flaws, and finding a lighthearted way to move forward despite lifeâ€™s dangers. This article discusses DLF's strong performance driven by robust demand for luxury homes.  DLF reported a significant increase in sales bookings, exceeding its guidance for FY24.  The company's luxury segment saw particularly strong sales, with projects like The Arbour contributing significantly to revenue.  DLF is actively pursuing new project launches to capitalize on the continued demand in the luxury housing market.  The article highlights DLF's focus on both residential and commercial/retail developments, with a healthy financial position supporting its expansion plans.

this is not  only THE best Imagine Dragons music vid, it also has an insane story. Like it follows a group of organized criminals in Vegas doing a heist of a casino, you can see easter eggs of their plan in the video if you look closely. The guy in the suit is also a criminal doing the main job, the person making is using sleeping aid to knock out a security guard and the woman throwing poker in the air is a distraction.
I just realized they're singing about life around casinos in Las Vegas. It's so vivid â€” being surrounded by people who are like sharks, driven solely by money. You have to give it everything you've got just to survive the race.

Escrita por Virgilio durante el reinado de Augusto, la epopeya combina elementos Ã©picos, mitolÃ³gicos y polÃ­ticos para contar la historia de Eneas, un hÃ©roe troyano que, tras la caÃ­da de su ciudad, emprende un largo viaje que lo lleva a establecer las bases para la fundaciÃ³n de Roma. AdemÃ¡s de Eneas, quien se destaca por su valentÃ­a y lealtad a su destino, encontramos a Dido, la reina de Cartago, cuyo trÃ¡gico amor por Eneas desempeÃ±a un papel importante en la historia. Por otro lado, Turno, el rey Rutuliano, representa el conflicto bÃ©lico con el hÃ©roe troyano. NEWSFLASH! -According to the Bible, God's elect are those who respond to His call and are chosen by Him12. The doctrine of predestination, as taught by Calvin, also speaks of God's elect1. The Bible does not mention two classes of Christians, but only the elect, whom God sovereignly chose in eternity to save through Jesus Christ2. The Bible does not instruct us to be concerned about our status of elect vs. non-elect, but rather calls us to believe and receive Jesus Christ as Savior3. The elect are sinners whom God has predestined to respond to the Gospel4. In different contexts, the Bible refers to God's elect as Jesus Christ, the people of Israel, those who inherit God's mountains or land, and those who inherit the new heavens and a new earth5. As the sun began to set and the shadows grew longer, a young woman named Lily found herself walking down a dark and deserted street. She had been out running errands all day and was eager to return home, but something was off. She felt like she was being watched, and every time she turned around, she saw nothing but the empty street behind her. She quickened her pace, hoping to make it home before anything could happen to her.  As she walked, she heard a faint whisper in her ear, "It's coming to get you." She spun around, but once again, there was nothing there. Lily's heart raced as she tried to shake off the feeling of dread that had settled in her chest. She knew she had to keep moving, but her feet felt heavy, as if they were stuck in place.  Suddenly, she saw a figure emerge from the shadows. It was a woman, dressed in rags and with wild hair. Lily took a step back, but the woman stepped forward and spoke in a raspy voice, "Uh uh, hiding your tears."  Lily was taken aback. How did this woman know about her tears? She had been crying earlier, but she thought she had wiped away all evidence of her sadness. The woman continued, "You think you are better than them, but it's just the same as them."  Lily didn't understand what the woman meant. Who was she talking about? But before she could ask, the woman vanished into thin air, leaving Lily standing alone on the empty street.  Lily continued on her way home, her heart pounding in her chest. What did the woman mean? Who was "them"? And how did she know about Lily's tears? As she walked, she began to realize that the woman's words had hit a nerve. She had been feeling superior to others, thinking that she was better than them, but the truth was, she was just as vulnerable and human as anyone else. Her tears were proof of that.  By the time Lily arrived home, she had come to a realization. She couldn't let her pride and ego get in the way of her humanity. She needed to be kind and compassionate to others, even if they didn't always deserve it. And most importantly, she needed to allow herself to be vulnerable and ask for help when she needed it.  From that day forward, Lily approached life with a newfound humility and empathy. The strange encounter with the woman in the shadows had taught her a valuable lesson, one that
They planned out an operation, got everything arranged, trained themselves, and conducted an entire heist. To surf with sharks.  Hell yeah.

So the point of the heist was to sneak into an underground area behind the theater's stage, dodge some lasers, and unleash some sharks into the ground-level fountain so that he can surf across the shark-infested fountain?  Personally, I think that it might have been better off with the first half of the song covering the heist, and the second half having everyone involved start betraying each other (your call whether you want one survivor or none), since that would match the theme of the song more than "some sharks randomly swimming in an underground tank beneath the Las Vegas strip".

I wondered what this song could be about, and I found it's meaning... At least for me... "Your in, then your out, your hot then you cold, you are swimming with sharks"... It's a metaphor for friendships... One day you will be in, you will be on hotspot, you will be the man, next moment you will be out, you will be cold and you will understand that you are swimming with sharks... The faster we realize that we are all sharks, the better we will swim all together... Most of the time I found happiness in hanging with people, but now... I want to become a shark... Just you wait and you'll see that you're swimming with sharks... Great song

(But then again, you already knew that ;) ) Video: Itâ€™s great, but (and I know I might get hate for this) the lyrics video did better at capturing the vibe of this song than the official music video. Now, donâ€™t get me wrong, I love this video, itâ€™s great! But certain moments just donâ€™t line up with the tone of the lyrics. (A good example of this is 2:14 - 2:30 in the vid, itâ€™s honestly jarring) The official lyrics video on the other hand is amazing at capturing the tone and message of the song (at least, in my opinion) about how we mistreat others around us (using sharks as a example) to benefit ourselves. If you think this video is perfect in every way, then good for you! I can completely understand why you think that! I just donâ€™t feel the same about this video. The song is amazing tho, 10/10

And so trying to have adn keep an emotional boundary, system and emotional striations. As well with living out loud so that there are systems adn signs. And flags.  But also finding the fast lane but after I find a healthy and safe space to fumble slowly. Ugh wanting to collaborate but not be possibly brought down by the wrong teammate. Not leave myself out and or possibly behind emotionally. As well as trying to count myself in as a person. Adn not limiting myself to one version. Knowing the box so that I can decide if and when I would like to stay within it. Having my own box so that I can know that I am not crossing other peoples lines if I should chose to step out of my box. Know my healthy and safe limits from pushing myself to go far, but also know when and how to safely stop. SO that I am not the one neither who could very well be crossing my own emotional wall, line, limit and or boundary. Its a lot. Its a Quarterly Report. Emotional Tax Season. You Know. That Im walking a circle around my limits before I go fast. SO that I already have a muscle memory. And parent functions of just what it is and how people may and or also can react respond to it. So that when I feel like going my own speed. I dont have to worry about potentially dragging anybody, people not keeping up. This will go higher ğŸŒ¡ï¸
Sharks is a song about liars, and this video perfectly captures it.  The overall theme of this video is heist-styled, but they're not actually stealing anything - they're letting sharks loose. Stealthy heists are compiled of lies so no one knows that anything is being stolen or messed with. But why set loose sharks? Because sharks, in terms of lyrics, are liars. Liars who would try to stop anything that gets in their way, like how sharks set prey on the first person they see, especially if the person panics. By letting sharks loose, Dan Reynolds has released lies to the world - and with that many sharks, the lies are unstoppable.  The video begins with Reynolds planning with his team - what facts would cause the lie to fail, and what would support it. Then comes the distractions - whether it's drugging the camera guy, engaging some guards in a conversation, or causing a ruckus to clear a pathway, these actions distract those who have the highest chance of exposing the lie.  A notable moment is the bridge, where Reynolds sneaks through a bunch of lasers. It's a high-tension moment, as one wrong move can already ruin the whole scheme. Reynolds is forced to make absurd moves - or, conceptually, stretch the truth in wild ways - to finally set loose the sharks.  In the end, this video is not just a heist story - it's a metaphorical showcase of how one lie can set loose more. And it's amazingly made, I can tell you that.

POT FARMER DANCE SONG % I got out my pipe stuffed it with pot You better believe it held a whole lot. I whipped out a lighter thumbed up a flame Sucked down that smoke which comforts my brain.  I tried alcohol smoked cigarettes They did nothing but give me regrets. My mom had arthritis could not walk around I rolled her a joint she danced on the ground.  I thought I was losing my lovemaking knack After I smoked some to me it came back. Soon I decided prices were high I searched for some ground I wouldn't have to buy.  I bargained for seeds from smokers all around  Got in my truck and drove out of town. I walked through the woods where wild birds nest  Found me the meadow I thought was the best.  I dug up the ground sowed all my seeds Said a small prayer for strong, healthy weeds. I watered at night with a five-gallon pail  Mosquitoes went hungry for I wore a veil.  Seven months went by; I thought I would die Till the Halloween moon was high in the sky. At night I went out, in a camouflage suit  Used my corn knife to chop down the loot.  I hung it up to dry where it couldnâ€™t be found. Came back and got it, when it had turned brown. I trimmed off the buds, stuffed them in bags Called all my friends and passed out free drags.  In less than a week my crop was gone  I flew to St. Thomas with a love hungry blonde!!  By Kansas City Poet Tom Zart Google = Most Published Poet On The Web Tomâ€™s 1,650 Poems Are Free To Share! Google = George Bush Tom Zart Google = Pot Farmer Poem
